archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files
1925-1930
did.physdesc: This collection consists of ca. 2900 items.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access restrictions may apply to specific student records under the terms of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (F.E.R.P.A.).

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files, Accession #RG-2/1/2.472 VII, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These files (ca. 2,900 items) constitute the major record series generated by Edwin Anderson Alderman, the first president of the University of Virginia. The records consist chiefly of correspondence, but also include reports, minutes, clippings, memoranda, and related papers concerning all areas of business of the president's office.

arrangement.head: Process Information
arrangement.p: Archival transfer, Office of the President, 1980 April 22. Originally accessioned as MSS 2636-b, 1947 November 15. Blueprint transferred to RG-31/2/11.811.

did.unittitle: "A" Miscellaneous --Abbot, Lawrence, editor of Outlook--re Vergil celebration, Thomas Jefferson; Abernethy, Charles L., Congressman from North Carolina; Academy of Political Science; Adams, Samuel L., delegate in General Assembly, expressing opposition to anti-prohibition speakers and professors; American Council on Education; American Philosophical Society; Amphitheater--amplifier equipment; Angell, James, president of Yale 1925-1930
Alumni Board Allotments from Contingent Fund guaranteed by Alumni Board of Trustees 1925-1930
Alumni Board General Correspondence--Reports on Endowment Fund 1925-1930
Alumni Board Meetings--Report on Endowment Fund 1925-1930

Art, Architecture, Music--Carnegie Corporation scholarships in Fine Arts--Otto Kahn address; Kearny gift of pictures; proposed addition to Law School; Beaux Arts Ball; play-writing; gifts of art work 1925-1930
"B" Miscellaneous (1-6 of 8)--Bagby, B.B., Chief Medical Inspector; Bureau of Health; Barr, Stringfellow; Battle, George Gordon; Bibliography; Boothe, Armistead L. 1925-1930
"B" Miscellaneous (7-8 of 8)--Brookings Institution; Bryan, John Stewart of the Richmond News Leader; Buchanan, Benjamin F.; Buenos Aires; Byrd, Harry F.; Byrd, Richard E. 1925-1930
Biology--Complaint from Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals re alleged snake fight; Andrew Fleming Prize in Biology 1925-1930
"C" Miscellaneous (1 of 8)--Calendar; Canby, Henry S., editor of the Saturday Review; Cannon, Bishop James, re prohibition; Carnegie Endowment for International Peace; Catalogue 1925-1930
Chemistry--American Chemical Society Prize Essay Contest; DuPont fellowships; research of John Yoe; teaching fellowships in the laboratory sciences 1925-1930
Convocations--list of recipients of intermediate honors 1925-1930

"D" Miscellaneous --Dabney, R. H.; Davis, Arthur Kyle; Davis, John Staige; Denny, George H., president, University of Alabama; Drewry, Patrick Henry, U. S. House of Representatives; drinking; Duke, Samuel, president, State Teachers College [James Madison], Harrisonburg, Virginia; DuPont, Alfred 1925-1930
"E" Miscellaneous --Edmunds, Mrs. J.E. re paintings; Elliott, Milton C.; English Speaking Union 1925-1930
Economics--proposal to create a Bureau of Business research in the Commerce School 1925-1930
Engineering Department, General--Industrial survey of Waynesboro 1925-1930
Finances--Budget; Phi Kappa Psi land value 1925-1930
Forestry--Proposal to move location of State Forester's office from the University; Seward Forest bequest 1925-1930
Fredericksburg College--recommendations for new presidency; see also Co-ordinate College 1925-1930
"G" Miscellaneous --Gault, Robert H.; Gee, Wilson; Guggenheim Foundation 1925-1930

Governor's Office--Byrd visit; Budget report to Byrd after reorganization of state government; keynote speech, Byrd, Harrisonburg; Trinkle, Stone Mountain Memorial "Harvest Campaign" coins; salary for Watson; insurance letter re dynamite in Cabell Hall; R. E. Byrd North Pole conquest; gifts to University of Virginia.; DuPont Trust; alcohol at UVa. 1925-1930
"H" Miscellaneous --Hartridge, Evelyn B. re Julien Green; Hollins College; Hoover, Herbert 1925-1930
Higher Education, Education Survey Report and Commission to Unify Higher Education 1925-1930
History --complaints over lack of office space and lecture rooms 1925-1930
History Department Research Professorship in Southern History 1925-1930
"I" Miscellaneous--Institute of Citizenship and Government; Institute of International Education; Institute for Research in the Social Sciences; Institute of Public Affairs 1925-1930

Institute for Research in the Social Sciences (1of 5)--gifted children; Wilson Gee; Laura Spelman Rockefeller Memorial; Committee recommendations for formation of Institute: Gee, Gooch, Ferguson, Smithey, Malone, Kincaid; Second Conference on Teaching and Research in the Social Sciences, Southern Region, at UVa., March 1926; D. W. Willard; Howard W. Odum; candidates for professor of sociology 1925-1926

Institute for Research in the Social Sciences (2 of 5)--all correspondence with Rockefeller Memorial, including lengthy letters from Alderman, and a memorandum for Alderman on a conference with Professor Odum at Chapel Hill, NC re the Rockefeller Grant 1926 Jan- Jun

Institute for Research in the Social Sciences (3 of 5)--Applications and recommendations for head of Institute; H.W. Chase, President, University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill; Gee re responsibility of University of Virginia to public welfare in Virginia; alumni of Richmond to set up research professorship in Social Sciences; minutes of meeting, Alderman, Smithey, Snavely, and Gee, setting up Research Council; State Board of Public Welfare plan for School of Social Sciences at University of Virginia; Frank Bane; Dumas Malone; Floyd House; budgets; minutes; Beardsley Ruml; space; program suggestions; organization plan; Social Science Research outlines for University of Chicago and Columbia University 1926 Jun-Dec

Institute for Research in the Social Sciences (4 of 5)--Budgets; letters re Wylie Kilpatrick to become Associate Research Professor; annual reports; Douglas Southall Freeman, The News Leader, Richmond, Va. complimenting Gee; Beardsley Ruml for the Rockefeller Memorial; University of North Carolina report to Rockefeller Memorial; American Council of Learned Societies questionnaire on research; Institute Executive Council meeting 1927

Institute for Research in the Social Sciences (5 of 5)-Edward L. Stone re Public and Private Welfare Survey of Roanoke, Va.; Gooch report to Gee on "Regionalism in France" study; Gee to Floyd H. Marvin, President, George Washington University re the Institute; Gee report re Va. Social Science Association; Alderman re Institute publications; Gee article for The Charlotte Observer, "Higher Education and Southern Progress"; minutes and report from Fall 1929 Institute meeting; annual report, 1927; Social Science Research Council Requests information; Rockefeller Memorial and Social Science Research Council re Gooch; Gee to Philip Parsons, University of Oregon, re Institute; 2nd Annual Report, 1928; Alderman to Ruml, Rockefeller Memorial, mentions lecture by Charles A. Beard at University of Virginia; Virginia Social Science Association re its own formation; Institute Brochure, 1927-1928; Institute Budget Sheet, 1928-1929 1928-1930

"J" Miscellaneous--Jackson, Ed, governor of Indiana; Jaffe, Louis I.; Consulate General of Japan; Jarman, J.L., president of State Teacher's College, Farmville [Longwood]; Jefferson, Thomas; Jefferson Society 1925-1930
"K" Miscellaneous --Kahn Foundation for Foreign Travel, James Southall Wilson proposed; Kallenbach scholarship; Kappa Delta Pi; Fiske Kimball 1925-1930
Law Department, General--letter to John Bassett Moore re strengthening instruction in International Law; recent Law Library acquisitions; needs of the Law School 1925-1930
League of Nations Non-Partisan Association--Alderman to serve on National Advisory Council 1925-1930
Legislative Bills re University of Virginia 1925-1930
Legislative Program --Report on progress of Agriculture in Virginia; budget; Byrd, Harry F. re the University; emphasis on medical program; Centennial celebration 1925-1930
Library, General --book lists; statistics; Poe portrait; James McConnell cap; fund for books on Negro [Arthur Curtiss James donation]; information re Jefferson manuscripts in library 1925-1930
Library, General --list of donors; Library Committee minutes 1925-1930

"M" Miscellaneous --McConnell statue; Maphis, Charles G.; Memminger, C. G. re Baron Powell Rammingen's autograph collection; Metcalf, J. C. re books on Negroes for the library [Arthur Curtiss James donation] 1925-1930
Medicine, School of--Hospital Ward Patient Statistics 1925-1930
Miscellaneous--College shield; Alma Mater song; sabbatical leave; request for information about alumni and traditions at the University 1925-1930
"N" Miscellaneous (1 of 2)--Narcotics; National Committee for Mental Hygiene; National Education Association; National League of Women Voters 1925-1930
"N" Miscellaneous (2 of 2)--Near East College Association; Near East Relief 1925-1930
"P" Miscellaneous --Painting walls by students; Phelps-Stokes fellowships; Phi Kappa Sigma Fraternity; Poe Room 1925-1930
Page School of International Relations at Johns Hopkins 1925-1930
Philosophy--suggestions for enrichment and enlargement of graduate work in philosophy; portrait of Albert Lefevre; proposed changes in the course "History of Philosophy" 1925-1930
Political Science--Geneva School on International Studies 1925-1930
"Q" Miscellaneous--Quarles, Fred, president of Omicron Delta Kappa; Queen of Rumania 1925-1930
"R" Miscellaneous --Randolph, Hollings, list of graduates of law Class, 1895; Raskob, John J.; Rockefeller, Jr., J. D.; Rural Sociology 1925-1930

Radio --Report on radio broadcasting; Alderman's acceptance as member of Advisory Council to National Broadcasting Company; Stringfellow Barr's ideas; hearings before the United States Senate; George Zehmer suggestions 1925-1930
Radio Broadcasting Systems at High Schools and Universities 1925-1930
Research--Proposed establishment of an institution for research in the Social Sciences 1925-1930
Rockefeller Commission: Appeal for grant for library for cataloging 1925-1930
Romance Languages--Bolivar; plan to furnish Romance Pavilion with antiques; Ormond Smith gift to french Room; Claude Swanson re dedication of French Room 1925-1930

"S" Miscellaneous --Scott, Frederic; seal; Self help student employment; University Senate re Yellow Journal; Seven Society re Jim McConnell; making of Shenandoah National Park; Sigma Xi; Silver, W.H. re iron spike from Rotunda, 1895 fire presented to University of Virginia; Social Sciences Institute; student fees; student health; student organizations 1925-1930
"S" Miscellaneous--Swannanoa; Swanson, Claude; death of Symmers student 1925-1930
Sesquicentennial--plaster model of University of Virginia by Victor Mindeleff 1925-1930
Sociology--tentative six-year program for the development of the School of Sociology 1925-1930
Southern Women's Educational Alliance Fellowship in Sociology 1925-1930
Sullivan Foundation Award--given by N.Y. Southern Society--bronze plague for "admirable spiritual qualities" 1925-1930
"T" Miscellaneous -- College Topics; Tunstall, Robert B., re Dartmouth 1925-1930
Term Reports--statistics of number of enrollments in each class, number dropped, number passing and failing 1925-1930
"U" Miscellaneous--Underwood, Oscar W., editorial at time of his death; United Daughters of the Confederacy; U. S. departments; University Club of New York; University Cruising Club 1925-1930
University Houses: Applications for the Pavilions 1925-1930
"V" Miscellaneous--Van Demark, R. W., renomination of Samuel Colcord for Nobel Peace Prize 1925-1930
"V" Miscellaneous--Varsity Club; Veterans' Bureau; Virginia Academy of Science 1925-1930
